abstract: As the bank grapples with regulatory battles, some shareholders are taking public aim at individual directors who hold crucial positions on the bank’s audit and risk committees.
snippet: As the bank grapples with regulatory battles, some shareholders are taking public aim at individual directors who hold crucial positions on the bank’s audit and risk committees.
lead_paragraph: As JPMorgan Chase’s annual meeting nears, much of the tension surrounds a critical vote to split the chairman and chief executive roles — a decision that could strip Jamie Dimon, the bank’s influential leader, of the dual titles he has held since 2006. Behind the scenes, though, another battle is brewing.

headline.main: JPMorgan Directors Feel Heat in a Vote
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan’s Directors Feel Heat In a Vote

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
